index.title: Build the next Ruby for Wasm with Artichoke
description: Bundle Ruby applications into a single Wasm binary with Artichoke, a Ruby made with Rust. The modular interpreter enables running untrusted code.
Artichoke is pre-release software. We're looking for contributors to build a Ruby for pure Wasm targets.

install.title: Install
install.content: Install Artichoke Ruby nightly builds with rbenv, Docker, or Cargo.
install.hint: Nightly builds include artichoke (ruby) and airb (irb) binaries. The Artichoke Ruby Core and Standard Library runtime is bundled in these two artifacts.

subscribe.title: Subscribe
subscribe.content: Stay up to date with project updates on Twitter
subscribe.hint: We'll tweet about Rust, crates we're developing, and new releases.

install.title: Install Artichoke â€“ Artichoke Ruby
install.targets: Artichoke Ruby installs on Linux, macOS, and Windows. New builds are pushed nightly.
install.try: Try out a build using one of these installation methods.
install.description: Install Artichoke Ruby, a Ruby made with Rust.

nightly.title: Pre-compiled nightly builds
nightly.content: Download a pre-compiled binary from artichoke/nightly. Binaries are available for Linux, Linux/musl, macOS, and Windows.
nightly.hint: These daily binaries track the latest trunk commit of Artichoke. Binaries are also distributed with ruby-build.

docker.title: Docker images
docker.content: Nightly builds of Artichoke are pushed to Docker Hub. Images are built on Ubuntu 18.04, Debian Buster Slim, and Alpine 3.
docker.hint: These daily images track the latest trunk commit of Artichoke.

cargo.title: Using Cargo
cargo.content: Artichoke builds and installs using Cargo, the Rust package manager.
cargo.hint: Building with Cargo compiles the latest trunk commit of Artichoke.
